results.title: A Grain of sand
results.creator_credit: David Keith Hardy, John Luck and UNICEF
results.brief_description: Firstly children’s needs are dramatised through a poem by William Blake and drawings by Ronald Searle. Then we follow a 10 year old Tunisian Arab boy to a health clinic, a school and a vocational training centre - three concrete ways to help meet children’s needs.
results.creator_credit_for_label: David Keith Hardy, John Luck and UNICEF

results.title: Graham Sutherland
results.creator_credit: John Read, John Elliot and BBC-TV
results.brief_description: A films about distinguished English painter best known for his portraits of Somerset Maugham, Lord Beaverbrook and Sir Winston Churchill. Sutherland is, however, a landscape artist who treats his subjects in a highly personal and poetic manner, which goes beyond surface realism. Descriptive sequences were specially shot in Pembrokeshire and in the South of France to show landscapes which have influenced his painting. The film concludes with a personal statement by the artist about his approach to his work.

results.title: Goya: the disasters of war (TEFC)
results.brief_description: In 1807, Spain was “peacefully” invaded by the armies of Napoleon, plunging the country into a long, cruel and bloody war. Francisco de Goya, the great Spanish painter, recorded the catastrophe of this war in a series of lithographs which are reproduced in this film. The transition from peace to rebellion, the brutality and futility of total war, and the grimness of death, are portrayed with bitter clarity by the artist. Narrated by Joseph Armesto and American narration by Frank Gehlein.

results.title: The Goya effect
results.creator_credit: Michael Tuchner, Ian Latimer and Rank Aldis Industrial Services
results.brief_description:
Episode number 7 of Series “Manager in Action”.
Demonstrates the limitations of formal information systems. Highlights the importance of spending time at the “sharp” end and the role of non-verbal signals in face to face communication. Intended for middle and junior managers in industrial and commercial organisations.

results.title: Got at (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Patricia Edgar and Centre for Study of Educational Communication and Media
results.brief_description: Presents the attitudes of a group of women trainee teachers towards sex-role socialisation. Seeks to stimulate discussion about the role teachers and school organizations play in fostering, reinforcing or changing sex-role stereotyping in Australian society.

results.title: Gore Road
results.creator_credit: Sarah Raxlen, Robert Verrall and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A journey of rediscovery down an old Quebec country road in the southwest corner of the province. Family pictures, snapshots, live photography, the homespun philosophy of old folks, some glimpses of the new generation - the impressions are many, varied and gathered at random to build this documentary study. Most of the film is monochrome, with a touch of color here and there to add a note of contrast.

results.title: Goodbye Lynn
results.brief_description: Tells the story of Lynn, a teenager, unwed and pregnant, and the problems she faces with her family, school friends, teachers, doctors and her boyfriend. Focuses on the interpersonal relationships and emotional stresses that affected the girl.

results.title: Good times two
results.creator_credit: Michael G. Ryan, Geoffrey Scott, Oxley Hughan and New Zealand National Film Unit
results.brief_description: This film tells of the adventures of two Australian girls on a flying visit to New Zealand. As they travel the country the girls are seen against a giant backdrop - New Zealand itself. Nearly all of it is shown - forests, farms, the rivers and lakes, ski-fields, and beaches, the volcanoes, and the cities…a lively introduction to New Zealand.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Michael G. Ryan, Geoffrey Scott, Oxley Hughan and New Zealand National Film Unit

results.title: Good speech for Gary
results.creator_credit: Bud Hollzer, Wilbur T. Blume, McGraw-Hill Films and University of Southern California
results.brief_description: Shows techniques of speech therapy used in a Californian class. Helps of all kinds are provided in the context of well-planned activities. Problems peculiar to individual children are dealt with by combined work of speech therapists, teachers, parents and health officials. Gives concrete suggestions (in the form of games and group activities) for correcting poor speech.
